name: ider

body.origin:
|- wer(cid, universe)
-| wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
-| wceq(cid, copab(hs0, hs1, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
-| diffss(hs0, hs1)
-| diffsc(hs0, cv(hs1))
-| diffsc(hs1, cv(hs0))
body.pretty:
⊢ =[Er]𝕌
⊣ (hs0 = hs1 → hs0 = hs1)
⊣ = = { < hs0, hs1 > | hs0 = hs1 }
⊣ d(hs0, hs1)
⊣ d(hs0, hs1)
⊣ d(hs1, hs0)

-| diffss(hs0, hs1)
-| diffsc(hs0, cv(hs1))
-| diffsc(hs1, cv(hs0))

comment: The identity relation is an equivalence relation. (Contributed by NM, 10-May-1998.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 22-Oct-2011.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jul-2014.)
